data name.eng_definition: name of the data set, named by data provider; This is your own unique data identifier. With this text string alone, you should be able to identify the materials (system) in your own internal data management system. (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)
data name.data_example: Zinc coated Fe-6Mn-3Al steel plate; Ti/Al dissimilar welded joint; Fe/C catalyst; Gd doped MOF 370; LLZO (Li7La3Zr2O12) Solid Electrolyte; Low Carbon TRIP Steel; 0.15C1.0Si1.5Mn1.5Al; Co single atom catalyst; Pt50Co50/TiO2; Material_1/Material_2/Material_3/Material_4;

Korea classification code.eng_definition: classification code for relevant fields of science and technology announced by Ministry of Science and ICT of KOREA (https://www.law.go.kr)

material system.eng_definition: selected materials system of the NCMRD standard scheme

data generation date.eng_definition: date when the data is added to the present database or data lake

data source.eng_definition: source information of the data, such as lab log, source publication, related projects, DOI of data, lead author, and publication date if the data is extracted from a publication; The DOI number referring to the published paper or dataset where the data can be found. If the data is unpublished, enter “Unpublished”; lead author is the surname of the first author. If several authors, end with et al. If the DOI number is given correctly, this will be extracted automatically from www.crossref.org ; publication date will be extracted automatically from www.crossref.org if the DOI number is given correctly.
data source.data_example: extracted from Acta Mater vol 13, page 2089 (2000); archived on 01/01/2021; 10.1016/j.actamat.2016.08.081; generated in CNMD, POSTECH (2021)

structure.eng_definition: structural information of materials in all scales; crystallographic, micro, meso and macro scales

lattice parameter.eng_definition:
Lattice parameters of the lattice according to the convention described in web.archive.org. 
The unit cell is the basic building block of a crystal, repeated infinitely in three dimensions. It is characterised by:
* three vectors (a, b, c) that form the edges of a parallelepiped;
* the angles between the vectors (alpha, the angle between b and c; beta, the angle between a and c; gamma, the angle between a and b).
Depending on the crystal system, there are sometimes restrictions on the values that unit cell parameters can take.

unit cell.eng_definition: the smallest portion of a crystal lattice that shows the three-dimensional pattern of the entire crystal

cell volume.eng_definition: three-dimensional space occupied by one unit cell in a crystal lattice

cell formula units.eng_definition: number of formula units of a substance contained within one unit cell of its crystal lattice

density of crystal structure.eng_definition: mass of the atoms within a unit cell divided by the volume of the unit cell

strukturbericht designation.eng_definition: crystal structure classification system established by the Zeitschrift für Kristallographie

space group.eng_definition: space group name or number of the structure

crystal system.data_example: cubic, hexagonal; trigonal; tetragonal; orthorhombic; monoclinic; triclinic;

Pearson symbol.data_example: cP3; cF23; cl5; hR12; hP2; tl4; tP7; ol4; oF8; oC8; oP2; mC6; mP4; aP16

extinction symbol.eng_definition: symbol represents specific systematic absences in a crystal's diffraction pattern

perovskite type.data_example: ABC3; inspired; 2d; 3d; Dion-Jacobson; Ruddlesden-Popper; quasi-2d; quasi-3d;

property.eng_definition: attribute, quality, or chracteristic of materials

corrosion property.eng_definition: properties related to deterioration of a material as it reacts with its envirionment via electrochemical and chemical reactions

anodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to anodic reactions on the electrode

cathodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to cathodic electochemical reactions on the electrode

corrosion current.eng_definition: anodic partial current due to metal oxidation

corrosion potential.eng_definition: electrode potential of a metal in a given corrosion system

corrosion rate.eng_definition: amount of corrosion loss per year in thckness

free corrosion current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the free corrosion potential

free corrosion potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential in the absence of net (external) electrical current flowing to or from the metal surface; The potential is measured with repsect to the potential of the reference electrode.

pasivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential, at which the corrosion current has a peak value, and above which there is a range of potentials, where the metal is in a passive state; The potential is measured with repsect to the potential of the reference electrode.

pasivation current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the passivation potential

pitting initiation potential.eng_definition: the lowest value of the corrosion potential at which pit initiation is possible on a passive surface in a given corrosive environment; The potential is measured with repsect to the potential of the reference electrode.

redox potential.eng_definition: potential of a reversible oxidation-reduction reaction in a given electrolyte recorded on a S.H.E. scale

re-activation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential below which reactivation takes place; The potential is measured with repsect to the potential of the reference electrode.

polarized potential.eng_definition: potential across the electrode/electrolyte interface that is the sum of the corrosion potential and the applied polarization

standard electrode potential.eng_definition: reversible potential for an electrode process when all products and reactants are at unit activity, recorded on a S.H.E scale.

transpassivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential above which the metal is in the transpassive state; The potential is measured with repsect to the potential of the reference electrode.

system_multilayer.eng_definition: Vocabularies for multilayer system in general. The system is usually composed of a thick substrate and the number of thin coated layers of various materials and thicknesses. Any thin film growth technology, like wet plating, electroplating, chemical or physical vapor deposition method might be used to prepared the multilayer system.

description.data_example: antireflection coating in VIS and UV range; DLC multilayer for Ge IR range window;

configuration.eng_definition: configurational information of the multilayer system

substrate.eng_definition: substrate material for the multilayer, one of the materials defined in the materials section.

layer_(n).eng_definition: n_th thin coated layer from the substrate

material.eng_definition: material of n_th layer, one of the materials defined in the materials section. Data is the variable name of the materials as appeared in the materials section

system_photovoltaic.eng_definition: information of photovoltaic system (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

description.eng_definition: description of the system such as major research theme or application

configuration.eng_definition: configurational information of the photovoltaic system

architecture.eng_definition:
The cell architecture with respect to the direction of current flow and the order in which layers are deposited. The two most common are nip (also referred to as normal) and pin (also referred to as inverted) but there are also a few others, e.g. Back contacted 
• nip architecture means that the electrons are collected at the substrate side. The typical example is when a TiO2 electron selective contact is deposited between the perovskite and the substrate (e.g. SLG | FTO | TiO2-c |Perovskite | …)   
• pin architecture means that it instead is the holes that are collected at the substrate side. The typical example is when a PEDOT:PSS hole selective contact is deposited between the perovskite and the substrate (e.g. SLG | FTO | PEDOT:PSS |Perovskite | …)

additional layer front.eng_definition: functional layer below the substrate, or on the opposite side of the substrate from with respect to the device layers

material.eng_definition: Material of the additional layer front. The layer can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

thickness.eng_definition:
Thickness of the layers in the additional layer front. 
• Thickness of each layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | '). 
• The layers must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

function.eng_definition:
The function of the additional layers front
• The function must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (‘ | ‘)
• If a layer has more than one function, e.g. A and B, list the functions in order and separate them with semicolons, as in (A; B)

substrate.eng_definition: configurational information of the substrate. With the substrate, we refer to any layer below the electron transport layer in a nip-device, and any laye rbelow the hole transport layer in a pin-device. The substrate can be a stack of layer of material_(n)

material.eng_definition: Material of the substrate. The substrate can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

thickness.eng_definition:
Thickness of the layers of the substrate. 
• Thickness of each layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | '). 
• The layers must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

area.eng_definition: The total area in cm2 of the substrate over which the perovskite is deposited. This may be significantly larger than the cell area

material.eng_definition: Material of the frontcontact. The frontcontact can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

n-type layer.eng_definition: configurational information of the n-type or electron transport layer. The layer can be a stack of material_(n). With the ETL, we refer to any layer between the substrate and the intrinsic layer in a nip-device, and any layer between the intrinsic layer and the back contact in a pin-device.
n-type layer.alias: electron transport layer; ETL; ETM; n-type materials

material.eng_definition: Material of the n-type layer. The layer can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

thickness.eng_definition:
Thickness of the layers of the electron transport layer. 
• Thickness of each layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | '). 
• The layers must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

intrinsic layer_(n).eng_definition:
information of the photo-absorber layer. Perovskite is used here. 
The layer can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack is sequentially listed one by one using the keywords "intrinsic layer_(n)".

material.eng_definition: Material of the intrinsic layer.

thickness.eng_definition:
Thickness of the layers of the intrinsic layer
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

single crystal.eng_definition: TRUE if the cell is based on a single crystal

p-type layer.eng_definition: information of p-type layer or hole transport layer

material.eng_definition: Material of the p-type layer. The layer can be a stack of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').
material.alias: hole transport layer; HTL; HTM; p-type materials

thickness.eng_definition:
A list of thicknesses of the individual layers in the stack.
• Every layer should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (‘ | ‘)
• The layers must line up with the previous filed.
• State thicknesses in nm
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

material.eng_definition:
Material of the backcontact. The backcontact can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the
materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

thickness.eng_definition:
A list of thicknesses of the individual layers in the stack.
• Every layer should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (‘ | ‘)
• The layers must line up with the previous filed.
• State thicknesses in nm
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

additional layer back.eng_definition: functional layer above the backcontact, or layers deposited after the backcontact has been finalized.

material.eng_definition: Material of the additional layer back. The layer can be a stack of layers made of material_(n) defined in the materials section. Every layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | ').

thickness.eng_definition:
Thickness of the layers in the additional layer back. 
• Thickness of each layer in the stack should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (' | '). 
• The layers must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer in the stack have a thickness. If it is unknown, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g write 100 and not 90-110

function.eng_definition:
The function of the additional layers back
• The function must line up with the previous material field.
• Every layer should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (‘ | ‘)
• If a layer has more than one function, e.g. A and B, list the functions in order and separate them with semicolons, as in (A; B)

encapsulation.eng_definition: TRUE is the cell is encapsulated

total area.eng_definition: The total cell area in cm2. The total area is defined as the area that would provide photovoltaic performance when illuminated without any shading, i.e. in practice the geometric overlap between the top and bottom contact.

area measured.eng_definition: The effective area of the cell during IV and stability measurements under illumination. If measured with a mask, this corresponds to the area of the hole in the mask. Otherwise this area is the same as the total cell area. (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

number of cells per substrate.eng_definition: The number of individual solar cells, or pixels, on the substrate on which the reported cell is made (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

module.eng_definition: configurational information of the module composed of connectec individual sub cells

number of cells in module.eng_definition: The number of cells in the module

total area.eng_definition: The total area of the module in cm2. This includes scribes, contacts, boundaries, etc. and represent the module’s geometrical footprint.

area effective.eng_definition: The active area of the module in cm2.

JV data recalculated per cell.eng_definition: The preferred way to report IV data for modules is to recalculate the IV data to average data per sub-cells in the module. That simplifies downstream comparisons, and it ensures that there is no erroneous transformation that otherwise may occur when error checking the IV data. Mark this as TRUE if the conversation is done.

flexibility.eng_definition: information of the flexibility if the cell is flexible and bendable (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

minimum bending radius.eng_definition: The minimum bending radius possible without degrading the cells performance (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

average transmittance.eng_definition: The average visible transmittance in the wavelength range stated in the next field. (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)

sample description.eng_definition: description of sample in any form of string, drawing or photo image, etc.

JV property.eng_definition: solar cell characterized by the JV measurement

reverse scan.eng_definition: solar cell characterized by the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)

Voc.eng_definition:
The open circuit potential, Voc, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give Voc in volts [V]
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1.03 and not 1.01-1.05
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Jsc.eng_definition:
The short circuit current density, Jsc, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give Jsc in mA/cm2
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.
Jsc.alias: short circuit current; short circuit current density

Pmax.eng_definition: A point on the curve where the product of the current (I) and voltage (V) is maximized

FF.eng_definition:
The fill factor, FF, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give FF as the ratio between Vmp*Jmp/(Voc*Jsc) which gives it a value between 0 and 1
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 0.73 and not 0.7-0.76
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

PCE.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give the efficiency in %
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Vmp.eng_definition:
The potential at the maximum power point, Vmp, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give Vmp in volts [V]
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1.03 and not 1.01-1.05
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Jmp.eng_definition:
The current density at the maximum power point, Jmp, at the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)
• Give Jmp in mA/cm2
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

series resistance.eng_definition: The series resistance as extracted from the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)

shunt resistance.eng_definition: The shunt resistance as extracted from the reverse voltage sweep (when U scanned from Voc to 0)

forward scan.eng_definition: solar cell characterized by the forward voltage sweep (when U scanned from 0 to Voc)

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

sample description.eng_definition: description of sample in any form of string, drawing or photo image, etc.

stability.eng_definition:
stability data of photovoltaic device
• There is no sharp boundary between a stability measurement and a measurement of stabilised efficiency. Generally, a measurement under a few minutes is considered as a measurement of stabilised efficiency, whereas a stability measurement is sufficiently long for degradation to be seen (unless the device is really good)

initial value.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell before the stability measurement routine starts
• Give the efficiency in %
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

burn in observed.eng_definition:
TRUE if the performance has a relatively fast initial decay after which the decay rate stabilises at a lower level.
• There are no sharp boundary between an initial burn in phase an a catastrophic failure, but if the performance of the cell quickly degrade by more than half, it is stretching it a bit to label this as an initial burn in phase.

final value.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell at the end of the stability measurement routine 
• Give the efficiency in % (of the initial value of PCE)
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

T95.eng_definition:
The time after which the cell performance has degraded by 5 % with respect to the initial performance.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1000 and not 950-1050
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Ts95.eng_definition:
The time after which the cell performance has degraded by 5 % with respect to the performance after any initial burn in phase.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1000 and not 950-1050
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

T80.eng_definition:
The time after which the cell performance has degraded by 20 % with respect to the initial performance.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1000 and not 950-1050
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Ts80.eng_definition:
The time after which the cell performance has degraded by 20 % with respect to the performance after any initial burn in phase.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1000 and not 950-1050
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

Te80.eng_definition:
An estimated T80 for cells that were not measured sufficiently long for them to degrade by 20 %. with respect to the initial performance.
• This value will by definition have a significant uncertainty to it, as it is not measured but extrapolated under the assumption linearity but without a detailed and stabilised extrapolation protocol. This estimate is, however, not without value as it enables a rough comparison between all cells for with the stability has been measured. 
• If there is an experimental T80, leave this field empty.

Tse80.eng_definition:
An estimated Ts80 for cells that was not measured sufficiently long for them to degrade by 20 %. with respect to the performance after any initial burn in phase.
• This value will by definition have a significant uncertainty to it, as it is not measured but extrapolated under the assumption linearity but without a detailed and stabilised extrapolation protocol. This estimate is, however, not without value as it enables a ruff comparison between all cells for with the stability has been measured. 
• If there is an experimental T80s, leave this field empty.

after 1000h.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell after 1000 hours 
• Give the efficiency in % (of initial PCE)
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

lifetime energy yield.eng_definition:
The lifetime energy yield
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

bending stability.eng_definition: PV cell efficiency data with the flexibility test

initial PCE.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell before the mechanical stability measurement routine starts
• Give the efficiency in %
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

final PCE.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell after the mechanical stability measurement routine
• Give the efficiency in % (of initial PCE)
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

PCE trace.eng_definition:
A link to where the data file for the stability data is stored
• This is a beta feature. The plan is to create a file repository where the raw files for stability data can be stored and disseminated. With the link and associated protocols, it should be possible to programmatically access and analyse the raw stability data.

outdoor.eng_definition: PV cell efficiency data with the outdoor performance test

initial value.eng_definition:

• Give the efficiency in %
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

burn in observed.eng_definition:
TRUE if the performance has a relatively fast initial decay after which the decay rate stabilises at a lower level.
• There are no sharp boundary between an initial burn in phase an a catastrophic failure, but if the performance of the cell quickly degrade by more than half, it is stretching it a bit to label this as an initial burn in phase.

final value.eng_definition:
The efficiency, PCE, of the cell at the end of the outdoor test routine 
• Give the efficiency in % (of the initial value of PCE)
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 20.5 and not 19-20
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

electrostatic interaction.eng_definition:
long range solver for electrostatic interaction; mathematical adjustment of interaction potential between two particles separated by long distances longer than a specified cutoff distance. 

Empirical potential methods often use the cutoff distance to make the calculations efficient limiting the number of pairs for which the interactions should be calculated. In this case, the interactions of particles far more apart than the cutoff distances is ignored. However, in many cases, especially with electrostatic interactions these long-range interactions still have significant contribution to the true potential energy. Long-range potential corrections are applied to include the effect of long range interactions.

accuracy.eng_definition: Relative strength of the Ewald-shifted direct potential at cutoff distance

number of cells averaged.eng_definition:
The number of cells the reported IV data is based on.
• The preferred way to enter data is to give every individual cell its own entry in the data template/data base. If that is done, the data is an average over 1 cell.
• If the reported IV data is not the data from one individual cell, but an average over N cells. Give the number of cells.
• If the reported value is an average, but it is unknown over how many cells the value has been averaged (and no good estimate is available), state the number of cells as 2, which is the smallest number of cells that qualifies for an averaging procedure.

certified.eng_definition: TRUE if the IV data is measured by an independent and certification institute. If your solar simulator is calibrated by a calibrated reference diode, that does not count as a certified result.

certification institute.eng_definition: The name of the certification institute that has measured the certified device.

storage before measurement.eng_definition: data for storage of the sample before measurement

age of cell.eng_definition: The age of the cell with respect to the last deposition step was finalized

atmosphere.eng_definition:
The atmosphere in which the sample was stored between the device finaliastion and the IV measurement.
• If the atmosphere is a mixture of different gases, e.g. A and B, list the gases in alphabetic order and separate them with semicolons, as in (A; B)
• “Dry air” represent air with low relative humidity but where the relative humidity is not known
• “Ambient” represent air where the relative humidity is not known. For ambient conditions where the relative humidity is known, state this as “Air”
• “Vacuum” (of unspecified pressure) is for this purpose considered as an atmospheric gas
• If the atmosphere has changed during the storing time, separate the different atmospheres by a double forward angel bracket with one blank space on both sides (‘ >> ‘)

relative humidity.eng_definition:
The relative humidity in the atmosphere in which the sample was stored between the device finaliastion and the IV measurement.
• Relative humidity is the actual amount of water vapor in the air compared to the total amount of vapor that can exist in the air at its current temperature
• If the relative humidity has changed during the storing time, separate the different relative humidity by a double forward angel bracket with one blank space on both sides (‘ >> ‘)
• If the relative humidity is not known, stat that as ‘nan’
• For values with uncertainties, state the best estimate, e.g. write 35 and not 30-40.

atmosphere.eng_definition:
The atmosphere in which the IV measurement is conducted
• If the atmosphere is a mixture of different gases, e.g. A and B, list the gases in alphabetic order and separate them with semicolons, as in (A; B)
• “Dry air” represent air with low relative humidity but where the relative humidity is not known
• “Ambient” represent air where the relative humidity is not known. For ambient conditions where the relative humidity is known, state this as “Air”
• “Vacuum” (of unspecified pressure) is for this purpose considered as an atmospheric gas

relative humidity.eng_definition:
The relative humidity in which the IV measurement is conducted
• Relative humidity is the actual amount of water vapor in the air compared to the total amount of vapor that can exist in the air at its current temperature 
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g write 35 and not 20-50.
• If the relative humidity is not known, stat that as ‘nan’

temperature.eng_definition:
The temperature of the device during the IV-measurement 
• If the temperature is not controlled and not is known, assume a standard room temperature of 25°C.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g write 35 and not 20-50.

light source.eng_definition: data on light source used for JV measurement

type.eng_definition:
The type of light source used during the IV-measurement
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template. 
• The category Solar simulator should only be used when you do not really know which type of light source you have in your solar simulator.
type.data_example: laser; metal halide; outoor; solar simulator; sulfur plasma; white LED; Xenon plasma

instrument.eng_definition:
The brand name and model number of the light source/solar simulator used.
• This category was included after the projects initial phase where for the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.
instrument.data_example: Newport model 91192; Newport AAA; Atlas suntest

simulator classification.eng_definition:
Classification of the light source/solar simulator used during the IV measurement according to the IEC 60904-9 Ed.3
• A three-letter code consisting of A+, A, B, and C. The order of the letters represents the quality of: spectral match, spatial non-uniformity, and temporal instability of the light source/solar simulator.

light.eng_definition: data of the characteristics of light illuminated during JV measurement

intensity.eng_definition:
The radiant power per unit area of light incident on a surface. In the case of the IV measurement of a photovoltaic device, it means the irradiance of the light source/solar simulator used during the measurement.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• Standard AM 1.5 illumination correspond to 100 mW/cm2
• If you need to convert from illumination given in lux; at 550 nm, 1 mW/cm2 corresponds to 6830 lux. Be aware that the conversion change with the spectrum used. As a rule of thumb for general fluorescent/LED light sources, around 0.31mW corresponded to 1000 lux. If your light intensity is measured in lux, it probably means that your light spectra deviates quite a lot from AM 1.5, wherefore it is very important that you also specify the light spectra in the next column.

type of spectrum.eng_definition: The spectral type of the light source/solar simulator used during the IV measurement
type of spectrum.data_example: AM 1.0; AM 1.5D; AM 1.5G; indoor light; monochromatic; natural sunlight; UV

wavelength range.eng_definition:
The wavelength range of the light source
• Separate the lower and upper bound by a comma
• For monochromatic light sources, give the same value for min and max values.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

illumination direction.eng_definition:
The direction of the illumination with respect to the device stack
• If the cell is illuminated through the substrate, state this as ‘Substrate’
• If the cell is illuminated through the top contact, state this as ‘Superstrate’
• For back contacted cells illuminated from the non-contacted side, state this as ‘Superstrate’

masked cell.eng_definition: TRUE if the cell is illuminated through a mask with an opening that is smaller than the total cell area.

mask area.eng_definition:
The area of the opening in the mask through with the cell is illuminated (if there is a mask)
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If there is no light mask, leave this field empty.

scan.eng_definition: data of parameter scan condition during IV measurement

sweep rate.eng_definition: The speed of the potential sweep during the IV measurement

delay time.eng_definition:
The time at each potential value before integration in the potential sweep.
• For some potentiostats you need to specify this value, whereas for others it is set automatically and is not directly accessible.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If unknown, leave this field empty.

integration time.eng_definition:
The integration time at each potential value in the potential sweep.
• For some potentiostats you need to specify this value, whereas for others it is set automatically and is not directly accessible.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If unknown, leave this field empty.

voltage step.eng_definition:
The distance between the measurement point in the potential sweep
• If unknown, leave this field empty.

voltage settling time.eng_definition: the time takes for the voltage across the solar cell to reach a stable and constant value after a change in the external circuit conditions

preconditioning.eng_definition: preconditioning condition if done before IV measureent

protocol.eng_definition:
Any preconditioning protocol done immediately before the IV measurement
• If no preconditioning was done, state this as ‘none’
• If more than one preconditioning protocol was conducted in parallel, separate them with semicolons
• If more than one preconditioning protocol was conducted in sequence, separate them by a double forward angel bracket (‘ >> ‘)
protocol.data_example: cooling; heating; light soacking; light soaking >> potential biasing; potential biasing

time.eng_definition:
The duration of the preconditioning protocol
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

potential.eng_definition:
The potential at any potential biasing step
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

light intensity.eng_definition:
The light intensity at any light soaking step
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

scan rate.eng_definition: the number of lines scanned per second

protocol.eng_definition:
The stability protocol used for the stability measurement.
• For a more detailed discussion on protocols and standard nomenclature for stability measurements, please see the following paper:
o Consensus statement for stability assessment and reporting for perovskite photovoltaics based on ISOS procedures by: M. V. Khenkin et al. Nat. Energ. 2020. DOI: 10.1038/s41560-019-0529-5

number of cells averaged.eng_definition:
The number of cells the reported stability data is based on.
• The preferred way to enter data is to give every individual cell its own entry in the data template/data base. If that is done, the data is an average over 1 cell.
• If the reported stability data is not the data from one individual cell, but an average over N cells. Give the number of cells.
• If the reported value is an average, but it is unknown over how many cells the value has been averaged (and no good estimate is available), state the number of cells as 2, which is the smallest number of cells that qualifies for an averaging procedure.

light source.eng_definition: data on light source used for stability measurement

type.eng_definition:
The type of light source used during the stability measurement
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template. 
• The category Solar simulator should only be used when you do not really know which type of light source you have in your solar simulator.
type.data_example: laser; metal halide; outoor; solar simulator; sulfur plasma; white LED; Xenon plasma

instrument.eng_definition:
The brand name and model number of the light source/solar simulator used
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.
instrument.data_example: Newport model 91192; MC-science, Lab100; Atlas suntest

simulator classification.eng_definition:
Classification of the light source/solar simulator used during the stability measurement according to the IEC 60904-9 Ed.3
• A three-letter code consisting of A+, A, B, and C. The order of the letters represents the quality of: spectral match, spatial non-uniformity, and temporal instability of the light source/solar simulator.

light.eng_definition: data of the characteristics of light illuminated during stability measurement

intensity.eng_definition:
The radiant power per unit area of light incident on a surface. In the case of the stability measurement of a photovoltaic device, it means the irradiance of the light source/solar simulator used during the stability measurement.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• Standard AM 1.5 illumination correspond to 100 mW/cm2
• If you need to convert from illumination given in lux; at 550 nm, 1 mW cm^{-2} corresponds to 6830 lux. Be aware that the conversion change with the spectrum used. As a rule of thumb for general fluorescent/LED light sources, around 0.31mW corresponded to 1000 lux. If your light intensity is measured in lux, it probably means that your light spectra deviates quite a lot from AM 1.5, wherefore it is very important that you also specify the light spectra in the next column.

type of spectrum.eng_definition: The spectral type of the light source/solar simulator used during the stability measurement
type of spectrum.data_example: AM1.5G; AM1.5D; AM 0; indoor light; monochromatic; natural sunlight; UV

wavelength range.eng_definition:
The wavelength range of the light source
• Separate the lower and upper bound by a comma
• For monochromatic light sources, give the same value for min and max values.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 100 and not 90-100.
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

illumination direction.eng_definition:
The direction of the illumination with respect to the device stack
• If the cell is illuminated through the substrate, state this as ‘Substrate’
• If the cell is illuminated through the top contact, state this as ‘Superstrate’
• For back contacted cells illuminated from the non-contacted side, state this as ‘Superstrate’

load condition.eng_definition:
The load situation of the illumination during the stability measurement.
• If the illumination is constant during the entire stability measurement, or if the cell is stored in the dark, state this as ‘Constant’. 
• If the situation periodically is interrupted by IV-measurements, continue to consider the load condition as constant
• If there is a cycling between dark and light, state this as ‘Cycled’
• If the illumination varies in an uncontrolled way, state this as ‘Uncontrolled’
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.

cyclng times.eng_definition:
If the illumination load is cycled during the stability measurement, state the time in low light followed by the time in high light for the cycling period. 
• If not applicable, leave blank

UV filter.eng_definition: RUE if a UV-filter of any kind was placed between the illumination source and the device during the stability measurement.

potential bias.eng_definition: potential bias applied during stability measurement

load condition.eng_definition:
The Potentiostatic load condition during the stability measurement
• When the cell is not connected to anything, state this as ‘Open circuit’
load condition.data_example: constant current; constant potential; MMPT; open circuit; passive resistance; short circuit

range.eng_definition:
The potential range during the stability measurement
• The lower and upper bound recorded in numeric list format of Python
• For open circuit conditions, state this as ‘nan’
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1 and not 0.90-1.1
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

passive resistance.eng_definition:
The passive resistance in the measurement circuit if a resistor was used
• Give the value in ohm
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1.03 and not 1.01-1.05
• If unknown or not applicable, leave this field empty.

load condition.eng_definition:
The load situation of the temperature during the stability measurement.
• If the temperature is constant during the entire stability measurement, state this as ‘Constant’. 
• If there is a cycling between colder and hotter conditions, state this as ‘Cycled’
• If the temperature varies in an uncontrolled way, state this as ‘Uncontrolled’
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.

range.eng_definition:
The temperature range during the stability measurement
• The lower and upper bound recorded in numeric list format of Python
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1 and not 0.90-1.1
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

cycling times.eng_definition:
If the temperature is cycled during the stability measurement, state the time in low temperature followed by the time in high temperature for the cycling period. 
• If not applicable, leave blank
• The lower and upper bound recorded in numeric list format of Python
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1 and not 0.90-1.1
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

atmosphere.eng_definition: atmosphere during stability measurement

oxygen concentration.eng_definition:
The oxygen concentration in the atmosphere
• If unknown, leave this field empty.

load condition.eng_definition:
The load situation of the relative humidity during the stability measurement.
• If the relative humidity is constant during the entire stability measurement, state this as ‘constant’. 
• If there is a cycling between dryer and damper conditions, state this as ‘cycled’
• If the relative humidity varies in an uncontrolled way, i.e. the cell is operated under ambient conditions, state this as ‘ambient’

range.eng_definition:
The relative humidity range during the stability measurement
• The lower and upper bound recorded in numeric list format of Python
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1 and not 0.90-1.1
• State unknown values as ‘nan’

average value.eng_definition:
The average relative humidity during the stability measurement.
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1 and not 0.90-1.1
• If unknown, leave this field empty.

total exposure time.eng_definition:
The total duration of the stability measurement. 
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 1000 and not 950-1050

time betweeen measurements.eng_definition: The average time between JV-measurement during the stability measurement

number of bending cycle.eng_definition: Number of bending cycles for a flexible cell in a mechanical stability test

bending radius.eng_definition: The bending radius of the flexible cell during the mechanical stability test

protocol.eng_definition:
The protocol used for the outdoor testing.
• For a more detailed discussion on protocols and standard nomenclature for stability measurements, please see the following paper:
o Consensus statement for stability assessment and reporting for perovskite photovoltaics based on ISOS procedures by: M. V. Khenkin et al. Nat. Energ. 2020. DOI: 10.1038/s41560-019-0529-5

number of cells averaged.eng_definition:
The number of cells the reported outdoor data is based on.
• The preferred way to enter data is to give every individual cell its own entry in the data template/data base. If that is done, the data is an average over 1 cell.
• If the reported stability data is not the data from one individual cell, but an average over N cells. Give the number of cells.
• If the reported value is an average, but it is unknown over how many cells the value has been averaged (and no good estimate is available), state the number of cells as 2, which is the smallest number of cells that qualifies for an averaging procedure.

composition.eng_definition: composition of precursor; weight ratio of each constituent of solvent

excess.eng_definition:
Components that are in excess in the material synthesis. E.g. to form stoichiometric perovskite MAPbI3, PbI2 and MAI are mixed in the proportions 1:1. If one of them are in excess compared to the other, then that component is considered to be in excess. This information can be inferred from data entered on the concentration for all reaction solutions but this gives a convenient shorthand filtering option. 
• If more than one component is in excess, order them in alphabetic order and separate them by semicolons.
• It there are no components that are in excess, write Stoichiometric

volume.eng_definition:
volume of precursor
• The volumes refer the volumes used, not the volume of the stock solutions. Thus if 0.15 ml of a solution is used, the volume is 0.15 ml
• When volumes are unknown, state that as ‘nan’

age.eng_definition:
The age of the solutions
• As a general guideline, the age refers to the time from the preparation of the final precursor mixture to the reaction procedure. 
• When the age of a solution is not known, state that as ‘nan’
• For reaction steps where no solvents are involved, state this as ‘nan’
• For solutions that is stored a long time, an order of magnitude estimate is adequate.

state.eng_definition:
The physical state of the preursor
• The three basic categories are Solid/Liquid/Gas
• Most cases are clear cut, e.g. spin-coating involves species in solution and evaporation involves species in gas phase. For less clear-cut cases, consider where the reaction really is happening as in:
o For a spray-coating procedure, it is droplets of liquid that enters the substrate (thus a liquid phase reaction) 
o For sputtering and thermal evaporation, it is species in gas phase that reaches the substrate (thus a gas phase reaction)
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.

encapsulating materials.eng_definition:
The stack sequence of the encapsulation
• Every layer should be separated by a space, a vertical bar, and a space, i.e. (‘ | ‘)
• If two materials, e.g. A and B, are mixed in one layer, list the materials in alphabetic order and separate them with semicolons, as in (A; B)
• Use common abbreviations when appropriate but spell it out if risk for confusion. 
• There are now separate filed for doping. Indicate doping with colons. E.g. wither aluminium doped NiO-np as Al:NiO-np

etching.eng_definition:
For the most common substrates, i.e. FTO and ITO it is common that part of the conductive layer is removed before perovskite deposition. State the method by which it was removed 
• If there is more than one cleaning step involved, separate the steps by a double forward angel bracket (‘ >> ‘)
• This category was included after the initial project release wherefor the list of reported purities are short, so be prepared to expand on the given list of alternatives in the extraction protocol.  (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)
etching.data_example:
Zn-powder; HCl >> Mecanical scrubbing
Laser etching

cleaning.eng_definition:
The schematic cleaning sequence of the substrate. The Extraction protocol does not capture the fine details in the cleaning procedures, e.g. times, temperatures, etc. but state the general sequence. Refers to the cleaning of the entire substrate before the deposition of the rest of the cell stack starts.
• If there is more than one cleaning step involved, separate the steps by a double forward angel bracket (‘ >> ‘)
• If more than one procedure is occurring simultaneously, e.g. Soap washing an ultrasonic bath, separate simultaneously occurring steps with a semicolon.
• This category was included after the initial project release wherefor the list of reported purities are short, so be prepared to expand on the given list of alternatives in the extraction protocol. (mapping: Perovskite DB 5.4)
cleaning.data_example:
Helmanex >> Ultrasonic bath >> Ethanol >> Ultrasonic bath >> Acetone >> UV-ozone
Piranha solutionion
Piranha solutionion >> UV-ozone
Soap
Soap >> Ultrasonic bath
Soap >> Ultrasonic bath >> Ethanol; Ultrasonic bath >> Acetone >> UV-ozone
Soap >> Ultrasonic bath >> UV-ozone
Unknown

quenching.eng_definition:
Rapid cooling of the specimen from high temeprature for manipulating microstructure or crystallinity of materials.

In perovskite synthesis process, quencing is a measure to discontinuosly acceleragte the crystallization 
• The most common case is the antisolvent treatment where a volume of a solvent in which the perovskite is not soluble is poured on the substrate during spin coating.
• The same effect can also be achieved by blowing a gas on the sample
• If the sample quickly after spin coating is subjected to a vacuum, this also counts as quenched induced crystallisation

media.eng_definition:
The solvents used in the quenching process i.e. antisolvent treatment
• If gas quenching was used, state the gas used
• If the sample quickly after spin coating was subjected to a vacuum, state this as ‘Vacuum’
• If an antisolvent was used but it is unknown which one, stat this as “Antisolvent”
• If no antisolvent was used, leave this field blank

media volume.eng_definition:
The volume of the media
• For gas and vacuum assisted quenching, stat the volume as ‘nan’
• If the sample is dipped or soaked in the media, state the volume of the entire solution

solvothermal synthesis.eng_definition: Solvothermal synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

heating rate.eng_definition: temperature at which heat treatment process is performed

cooling rate.eng_definition: temperature at which heat treatment process is performed

sol-gel synthesis.eng_definition: A method of synthesizing a homogeneous and high-purity solid material from a precursor such as a metal salt or metal alkoxide at room temperature or low temperature

pH.eng_definition: quantitative measure of the acidity or basicity of aqueous or other liquid solutions

time.eng_definition: Time of the Sol gel process

power.eng_definition: amount of power delivered to samples

sonochemical synthesis.eng_definition: sonochemical synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

precursor_(n).eng_definition: Precursor for material_n in the sonochemical process

name.eng_definition: Name of precursor for the sonochemical process

amount.eng_definition: Amount of precursor for the sonochemical process

name.eng_definition: name of solution for the sonochemical process

amount.eng_definition: amount of solution for the sonochemical process

ultrasonic frequency.eng_definition: ultrasonic frequency for the sonochemical method

power.eng_definition: amount of power delivered to samples

time.eng_definition: Time of sonication for the sonochemical method

spin coating.eng_definition: a procedure used to deposit uniform thin films onto flat substrates by centrifugal force

composition.eng_definition: composition of precursor; volume ratio of each constituent of solvent

volume.eng_definition:
volume of precursor
• The volumes refer the volumes used, not the volume of the stock solutions. Thus if 0.15 ml of a solution is used, the volume is 0.15 ml
• When volumes are unknown, state that as ‘nan’

age.eng_definition:
The age of the solutions
• As a general guideline, the age refers to the time from the preparation of the final precursor mixture to the reaction procedure. 
• When the age of a solution is not known, state that as ‘nan’
• For reaction steps where no solvents are involved, state this as ‘nan’
• For solutions that is stored a long time, an order of magnitude estimate is adequate.

state.eng_definition:
The physical state of the preursor
• The three basic categories are Solid/Liquid/Gas
• Most cases are clear cut, e.g. spin-coating involves species in solution and evaporation involves species in gas phase. For less clear-cut cases, consider where the reaction really is happening as in:
o For a spray-coating procedure, it is droplets of liquid that enters the substrate (thus a liquid phase reaction) 
o For sputtering and thermal evaporation, it is species in gas phase that reaches the substrate (thus a gas phase reaction)
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.

molarity.eng_definition: used quantity of precursor in mole

composition.eng_definition: composition of solvent; volume fraction of each constituent of solvent
composition.data_type: dictionary {solvent_n:volume ratio in solvent mixture without dimension,...}

atmosphere.eng_definition: synthesis atmosphere

spray pyrolysis coating.eng_def: spray pyrolysis synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

composition.eng_definition: composition of solvent; volume ratio of each constituent of solvent
composition.data_type: dictionary {solvent_n:volume ratio in solvent mixture without dimension,...}

atmosphere.eng_definition: synthesis atmosphere

spray speed.eng_def: spray speed in volume per hour

heat treatment time.eng_def: Heat treatment time for material synthesis

sputter deposition.eng_definition: deposition of thin films by sputtering and evaporating target materials in a vaccum chamber

base pressure.eng_definition: the lowest pressure of the processing chamber to pump down without any gas flows

working pressure.eng_definition: the pressure in the processing chamber during the sputter deposition process

sputtering gas.eng_definition: flow rate of sputter gas that form ionized particles in an electric field for sputtering process; in standard cubic centimeter per minute (sccm).

substrate distance.eng_definition: the distance between the target and the substrate

sputter power.eng_definition: electric power for the sputtering process

substrate rotation.eng_definition: rotation of substrate for uniform deposition

storage before process.eng_definition: information of delaying until next process

time.eng_definition:
The time between the additional layer front is finalised and the next layer is deposited
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 35 and not 20-50.

atmosphere.eng_definition: The atmosphere in which the sample with the finalised additional layer front is stored until the next deposition step.

relative humidity.eng_definition:
The relive humidity under which the sample with the finalised additional layer front is stored until next deposition step
• If there are uncertainties, only state the best estimate, e.g. write 35 and not 20-50.

surface pre-treatment.eng_definition:
Description of any type of surface treatment or other treatment the sample with the finalised additional layer front undergoes before the next deposition step.
• If more than one treatment, list the treatments and separate them by a double forward angel bracket (‘ >> ‘)
• If no special treatment, state that as ‘none’
• This category was included after the projects initial phase wherefor the list of reported categories is 
short. Thus, be prepared to expand the given list of alternatives in the data template.

thermal evaporation.eng_definition: a process for thin film deposition in a vaccum by evaporation of precursors (or source materials)

evaporating material.eng_definition: source materials being evaporated to be deposited on the substrate in a vacuum chamber

concentration.eng_definition: composition of evaporating materials; atomic ratio of each constituent of solvent

age.eng_definition:
The age of the evaporating materials
• As a general guideline, the age refers to the time from the production data of the evaporating material to the process date. 
• When the age of the material is not known, state that as ‘nan’

state.eng_definition:
The physical state of the evaporating materials
• The two basic categories are Solid/Liquid

working pressure.eng_definition: pressure in a processing chamber during thermal evaporation

substrate temperature.eng_definition: temperature of the substrate on which material is deposited

thermomechanical process.eng_definition: metal forming process that involve control of thermal and deformation conditions

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

initial temperature.eng_definition: initial temperature at which the n-th TMP process starts

heating rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is raised to n-th holding(or target) temperature

holding temperature_(n).eng_definition: Soaking temperature maintained during the n-th isothermal heat treatment

deformation holding_(n).eng_definition: amount of plastic deformation applied to materials at the n-th holding temperature

holding time_(n).eng_definition: holding time for the heat treatment at the n-th holding temperature

cooling rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is lowered to the n-th final temperature

deformation cooling_(n).eng_definition: amount of plastic deformation applied to materials during cooling to the n-th final temperature

cooling method_(n).eng_definition: method of cooling without specified cooling rate

final temperature.eng_definition: temperature when the n-th TMP process finished

wet etching.eng_definition: a process of removing or dissolving a material from a substrate using a liquid etchant solution

etching solution.eng_definition: a solution used to dissolve a material by reduction-oxidation reaction

etchant_(n).eng_definition: name of the etching agent (chemical) n

additive.eng_definition: additional substances added to an etching solution that affect the etch rate, surface morphology and undercutting

stirring rate.eng_definition: solution stirring process during the wet etching

numeric single data (\"data_type\" : \"n.format: single numeric data is composed of 'value' and 'uncertainty' in the unit defined for each keyword in the dictionary

numeric array data (\"data_type\" : \"nu.format: Array data is composed of an array of list data. Each list in the array is correspondent to each row of data except 0th list in the array. 0th list is the column names. The data in the following list is to be aligned with the sequence of the column names of the 0th list. Each column is either independent (cortrolled) variables or dependent (measured) variables. "array_example" is to be provided for users to understand better the array data structure.

column_definition.eng_definition: column names to be listed in 0th list are defined in this object.

(column_name)).eng_definition: Definition of column i.e. name of column; it can be either dependent or independent variables; uncertainty of the value can be added in the following column; columns can be defined as many as required for the data; listed in the same sequence of the array data.
(column_name)).data_type: (data type of the value in the column of array)
(column_name)).data_unit: (data unit of the value in the column of array)
(column_name)).data_example: (example of the value in the column of array)

array_example: ["column_name1","column_name2","column_name3"...]
[data of column1, data of column2, data of column3...]
[data of column1, data of column2, data of column3...]
[data of column1, data of column2, data of column3...]
[data of column1, data of column2, data of column3...]

suggested vocabulary.note: These vocabularies can be used in system "configuration" to define the morphology of the materials used in a materials system.

material.eng_definition:
material of core in core-shell structure; 
use the materials variable name defined in the materials section

diameter.eng_definition: average diameter of spherical core-shell particle

material.eng_definition:
material of shell in core-shell structure; 
use the materials variable name defined in the materials section

layer_(n).eng_definition: n_th thin coated layer from the substrate

material.eng_definition: material of n_th layer, one of the materials defined in the materials section. Data is the variable name of the materials as appeared in the materials section

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

sample description.eng_definition: description of sample in any form of string, drawing or photo image, etc.

note.eng_definition: addtional note about this layer other than the data
note.data_example: deposited layer is shiny green color; buffer layer to improve adhesion

complex.eng_definition: description if the material has complex morphology
